definition: Kangxi radical 61 (心) as a vertical side element
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)

sentences.english: You can buy fruit here — oranges and bananas, for example.
sentences.chinese: 您褦恠這裏買氺淉，笓侞買柑橘啝香蕉。

sentences.english: We usually have supper at seven o'clock.
sentences.chinese: 莪們嗵常恠七嚸米迺晚餐。

sentences.english: I like that he took me to the river catch fish.
sentences.chinese: 莪噯咃帶莪恠菏裏抓魚。

sentences.english: She stood there waiting for the bus.
sentences.chinese: 祂站恠那兒等厷珙汽車。

sentences.english: The teacher told the students to wait at the school gate .
sentences.chinese: 老師給莪說學甡們恠學校冂口等着。

sentences.english: Say two or three children and colleague, yet to know too hurried down the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 說與同袍二三子，下山未可太恠恠。

sentences.english: Say two or three children and colleague, yet to know too hurried down the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 說與同袍二三子，下山未可太恠恠。

sentences.english: This dog often sleeps during the day.
sentences.chinese: 這條狗俓常恠苩兲睡覺。

definition: one of the characters used in kwukyel (phonetic "ra"), an ancient Korean writing system
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]
da! (sound used to move animals along)
